oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Gravesite of William Lipscomb at Mt. Olivet, Nashville, Tennessee, 1980 March
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The gravesite of clergyman William Lipscomb (July 20, 1829-1908), located at Mount Olivet Cemetery in Nashville, Tennessee. William Lipscomb, born in Franklin County, Tennessee, was a leading figure of the American Restoration Movement. He and his younger brother David Lipscomb were students of Restoration Movement preacher Tolbert Fanning and were affiliated with the “Gospel Advocate” newspaper. Forms part of the Claynita Harris Slide Collection. The original is a 35 mm color transparency (2 x 2 in. slide mount)
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Lipscomb family
Mount Olivet Cemetery (Nashville, Tenn.)
